content: tried signing up. it says you gets a free stock, wrong! i gave them my ssn twice, my real name, not the one from facebook which they had, and my address twice. that worried me. then they wanted my bank info and to put money in robinhood to invest. invest in what. no stock! my daughter said i could hit skip and do it later. so i did. then they wanted a picture of my bank statement. they said it was to prove my address. i don't get bank statements,. i do paperless banking. got mad and gave up. don't believe good reviews!!!!!! iv reached out to robinhood on my application over the last month and have sent 3 different messages thru the app and too many emails. they replying to reviews how theyd like to get in contact but never respond. i have given them all my personal information needed and still nothing this is an unorgainzed app with even worse communication and the worst part is now they have my social security card my birth certificate and my i'd on file this is a fraudulent scam!!
downloaded this and thought it was a great idea, can't sign up with my bank.. wants all personal info, social security number and birthdate.. not feeling it. deleted!

i just do not like this whereas it asks for way too much personal information for a telephone app!! i am not comfortable at all putting in my date of birth, complete address and, the final straw, my social security number!!! all this 8nfornation is going to someone (or group) i have absolutely no idea who they are!! do not trust it!!

this is an app used for scammers. i downloaded the app and it wants your social security number, phone number, birthday, address, name and bank information. after having the app downloaded for less than 25 minutes i went into 'app info' on my phone and it says this app used 2.1gb of data. the only way it could use that much data is to upload my personal information from my phone to a server because the app had nothing it was downloading. avoid this app. dont get scammed.

the app requested all my personal info including bank acct, then "processed" for weeks. i had chosen to use a license instead of passport to apply, but then without warning they needed my social security card, and i couldn't go back and choose passport instead. i cannot get to my ss card during the pandemic bc it's out of state. no phone contact available, and took over a week for email reply, and they wont accept credit card statements, tax info, nothing, but they retain all my personal info.

i wanted to set up an account to try and get in on the craze surrounding gamestop, but the app wanted a picture of my physical social security card even when i already knew my ssn. i'm sure robinhood keeps information like that private, but i haven't been able to complete my account because of that. i've tried a couple of times to contact them to get my account deleted since i can't seem to delete it via the settings (probably because it's not fully setup) but i've yet to receive an email back.

for 3 weeks now i been sending emails to the website to cancel, and they still not gotten back to me. they can ask for personal information like social security number, but can not respond to an email to delete account!!!

for someone like myself who is not educated and grew up in the ghetto this app is not very helpful in sharing information. i didn't read an ounce of info about how stash works or ways to invest before i was forced to give pretty much every bit of personal documented information on me...which i did not feel comfortable with by the way so i uninstalled the app and now some of that info is lingering in their system. hopefully not to be sold to annoying marketing companies and third parties. at best i was able to log out before removing the app from my phone. point is i honestly thought this was an app with information on investing and opportunities to learn to invest but it seems you really have no option other than to go through with it. which if you're like myself and just looking for info and a small nudge-free opportunity this is not it. there was no "account set up" option when i opened the app. i was immediately prompted to give personal info (social security number, home address, even bank info) with no option to skip the questions and overall there was very little accessibility. when i tried the "email us" option i was not impressed with the automated answers as i was hoping since i was giving so much sensitive info i would at least get a live customer service agent. don't download unless you're actually looking to invest. if you need info just use the internet or call someone successful in your life.

i couldn't even actually create an account. after i gave them my bank account information and all my email and personal info, they asked for my social security number. they then rejected my number and reached out to support and they claimed that there was already an account in use with my social security, so i must have created an account in the past. so i gave them all my other email addresses and then they said that none of those emails had an ccount.
this app asks you for all your personal info, social security number, name, and obviously email address. i am not taking the chance to put that info out

it wants your social security number. i don't mind giving my name and email, but my ssn is where i draw the line for a mobile app. i wouldn't trust it. seems fishy.

they are not for the little guy as they claim, they have shown that over and over and over again. after raping your bank account they will sell all of your personal info including location, contacts, and your order flow to hedge funds to skim profit from your Ã£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âfree tradesÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Â do not trust vlad the con artists! facebooks privacy is more trustworthy..

someone signed me up for an account without my permission. i contacted them giving them this information and they wanted a copy of my driver's license and social security card to investigate the matter. like i'm going to give them more of my personal information.

after providing a copy of my social security number, proof of residency, as well as other personal information such as birth date ... i was contacted by the folks at acorns asking for a copy of my drivers license.

we just recently opened a new business and personal bank account, as well as a new retirement investment account ... and none of them ask for anywhere near the kind of proof acorns does ... let alone that they ask you to upload it digitally with no visible assurance of secure privacy...

no thanks.

i had heard about this service via an email promotion. i checked them out and decided to setup an account because i liked their overall purpose. while setting up my account i was given an error telling me that my ssn is already in use. i immediately contact them and they tell me they need all my personal information to close out the fraud account. i give them all the information also including an ftc report, police report, a picture of my social security card, photo of my license and address. then they tell me weÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âre sorry but we canÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât close the fraud account and the account youÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âre attempting to make has been permanently locked and wonÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât be approved. you will not be allowed to use our service.. this company is an absolute scam and i will be contacting my lawyer. user beware

they collected my personal info and photos of my driver's license and social security card and never approved or rejected my application. emailed them after 5 days, they asked for photos of my ssn card after i had sent the dl. i sent it the same day, and they promised approval within a day. it has been 46 days now! they literally stole my information and disappeared. i have all email communications as proof. tried calling them and it was just an answering machine! no real company. total scam!

fraud: this app is asks for my bank login credentials. i realize there may be a way to enter your bank routing info but that process was not readily available. it took me a couple min to set up but virtually impossible to close the account. i have asked multiple time to close my account. i only have the free stock which i do not want. please close it immediately and respond with an email that it has been closed. i have asked for this multiple times and i get the same generic response which tells me to 0 out positions. i have never made an investment or put money into the account. 

i did do some research and found numerous people have used this app and had charges made that they did not recognize. since they ask for your bank login credentials and not your routing information, it opens people up to this type of fraud.

horrible app and customer service, i signed up because a friend recommended it but i stopped once i saw they wanted my actual bank login and password which a person can use to log in to your account and change your information. i didn't trust this so i asked them to delete my account and info and they refused, saying it's against policy. don't use this app, it could be stealing your information.

installed this app based on an app review and then realized it wanted my bank login info before i could proceed. quickly uninstalled it. i can't believe people are using this app. you wouldn't give someone the password to your email; why give them your bank password? that is insane.

after watching its performance i decided it wasnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât good enough so on october 16th i decided to withdrawal the money. their policy says it would take up to 6 business days. after 10 business days had gone by, i decided to contact their customer service.the guy said he would check on it and get back to me. he did it after a few days.since then, iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âve replied to inumerous emails back and forth, more and more requests about my personal info. i just want the money to go back to the same account it came from. iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âve sent my bank statements 2 times by now, as well as my paypal statement. they keep giving more and more excuses, and requesting more and more personal info. the names match on my bank account, paypal and acorns. acorns claims a name discrepancy on my paypal account which iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âve already contacted and they say there isnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât one (paypal has a copy of my id and my marriage license, so).

do not do business with this organization.  all i wanted to do was switch to another bank account, but i was told that i need to provided bank statements from both accounts. i discussed this with my bank and they told me not to because it was highly suspicious to ask for personal information. after a manager was rude and flippant about the process, i asked to close my account. stash held my money hostage and kept asking for the bank statements. finally, someone told me that they would close the account and i would be mailed a check for the account balance. i asked if the check could be mailed to my work address since i work in a secure government building. they said no--unless i could provide them with a utility bill. i'm not sure how i'm supposed to obtain a utility bill for a courthouse.  i contacted them today and was told that my account was locked and that they could not send me a check without the bank statements. eventually, i had to re-link my old account in order to initiate the funds transfer.   i'm glad that i closed my account. this company is not pleasant to deal with.

i applied 4-5 days ago and queued a deposit from my bank. robinhood took my vital information and has been stuck processing my application for days and days. iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âve sent a handful of emails to their customer service with zero response other than their automated response saying they will get back to me. if i could fix any error i would. if i could restart the application i would. there is no option to see the actual status of the application and no way to resubmit documents it asked for, such as a bank statement. iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âm concerned i sent the wrong bank statement and now itÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs stuck in the application process so try out anyone getting back to me to my emails about support. iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âm afraid the money i queued for robinhood to take will randomly be taken away if i delete the app and go somewhere else to invest.

i tried to sign up for this app, but they kept asking me for pictures of my bank statements, utility bills & personal information that is irrelevant to an app. i have signed up for bank accounts with less info. a nightmare. avoid

i was unable to use because the app was not linking to my checking account. decided to give another try. my account is linked, but they locked my account and requested a photo of my bank statement. provided and they are emailing me telling me it is locked and i need to explain why their app wouldn't work. i am also being charged $1 monthly for an app i cant use. there does not appear to be a way to delet my bank account information to prevent them using it as well. seems like a huge scam!!!

iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âm a physician and have invested a decent amount of money with stash. i was happy with the company until last month when i closed the bank account i had linked to stash and forgot to update stash with my new bank account information. after i got an email from stash stating i needed to update my banking information i went to their website to provide my new account info. it was rejected. i emailed customer support and received a response several days later stating i had so send them a copy of my drivers license and my bank statement. i feel that this is a violation of my privacy and other similar investment accounts that i have do not ask for this personal information. after not getting any further responses from their customer support to resolve this issue, i decided to close my account and take my business elsewhere. i tried this 7 days ago and closed it online. except i havenÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât received my money back. furthermore stash has not responded to my emails. iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âve called their customer support number multiple times and no one every answers. i will be finally complaints with the sec and other authorities.  please use another company for your financial investments.

iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âm new to this. but the verification process has been frustrating to me. i was introduced by a friend. he told me he didnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât have to go through any verification. now he is using his app perfectly well. but i was asked to upload a us issued id first. when i started uploading, i realized it doesnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât have to be us issued. but it did say that it has to be us issued in the email and in the app. this is so confusing. i still donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât know if ids issued by other countries will be accepted. then i was asked to upload my bank statement for further verification when i hadnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât even heard back if my previously uploaded id was accepted or not. i donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât feel comfortable at all providing such personal information. i donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât see why this is necessary. very frustrated.

nothing about this company or its app can be considered secure. they me so many emails today asking me to send photo after photo of my bank statement. furthermore, they also asked for a pdf of my bank statement. i had to send them my photo 3 times of my bank statement. two with this app that does fuzzy pics or they donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât seem to get it. i also sent them the pdf and the pdf reference number 3 times. these people just donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât seem to care that you are sending private documents to them and they need to be getting these documents and stop asking for them over and over again. i am not sure this is even finally resolved. but, i will find a official government agency to report this behavior to. it just seems so disorganized and unprofessional! save your time and use someone else.

ok so this is what happened: i reset my password and for some stupid reason, it literally blocked me out from logging in. then i contacted customers service. i emailed them and told them what happened. they asked straight away for my bank statement, ssn, and id. so i asked them why and they just didnt explain. i was so frustrated and i sent them because i needed to get my money back. i sent them and now it's been 3 weeks since i emailed them every day waiting for a reply. hate hate hate Ã£Â°Ã¢ÂÃ¢Â¤Ã¢Â¬Ã£Â°Ã¢ÂÃ¢ÂÃ¢Â¡

pray you don't need help from customer service  purchased 125 of a stock at .63 the day it hit $2.15 i go to sell, account closed! after over an hour and a half on hold and 10+ unanswered emails i was informed i have to submit a picture of my license, a bank statement, and justify the deposit reversal. why? because my bank put a hold on 2 small deposits i submitted to robinhood in order to check with me to ensure it wasn't fraud. the larger deposit went through. and they had no problem taking an even larger deposit just prior to my accounting being close. so now i'm waiting to see if i am really me so i can have my account back. if not, i guess i am out the $270 i can sell the stock for and the $200 worth of deposits. oh did i mention, they charged me $30 for each of the deposits that we're stopped. so, upon resolution of this issue i would gladly give 3-4 stars but this has left a bad taste. and as my stock soars i have to wait until "sometime next week when we can get to reviewing it" to do anything. great app, great concept, fun, but all that is negated by the worst customer service i have ever had! when dealing with people's money, and personal information, this type of performance is absolutely ridiculous.

app straight up lies to you and says that the patriot act says they need to get all your personal info (i.e. ss number, birthday, etc.), but that's really only a half truth. the patriot act says they gotta make an effort to get it, but we still have the right to refuse. do you think they would let you refuse? of course not.

i downloaded the app and opened an account with the app, as a friend was using it. while playing with it, ( without pushing any confirmation button and i even backed out of the app halfway as i was confused) i accidentally opened another acorn later account. i only found out i have this new account when i checked my email. and the new account is going to charge me 2 dollars per month. i went back to the app to find a way to close this new account i did not open. the faq( which links to a website) said i would have to call to cancel it. then i tried to dig around again only to find a place to send email if i had concerns. i have to provide a lot of my personal information including my birthday in order to send out that email to customer service for an account i did not open in the first place. this is the worst experience i have ever had with any accosication/ company that deal with money.

the agreement required to be signed before using the app states fidelity is not responsible if the transaction gets intercepted and your privacy is breached.  if their encryption fails you are still responsible!  anything else they do wrong you are completely responsible, unlike if you were using your home computer.  i dont know if this would hold in court but it certainly doesnt give a warm and fuzzy about the mobile app, if they absolve themselves of all and any responsibility.  they also dont guarantee the accuracy of data they display, or whether any orders can be executed correctly.  i can understand if you are not careful with your password or mobile device and somebody else gets a hold of it and is able to do a transaction, you should be liable.  but they should at least take responsibility for losses if their encryption doesnt work and they breach data security.  the agreement also says you have to call them after a transaction, to get a printed copy, which is different than if you were using a home computer.  with a home computer you can set it so that you get written confirmation of all your transactions.

i have been interested in getting into investing and this app was recommended from a trusted friend who has been able to invest positively at her comfort level. with an abundance of companyÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs out there to choose from i decided to go with this one as i had a personal recommendation. 

almost a month ago i downloaded the app and attempted to start investing. i thought that once i linked my bank account i would be able to start investing right away, but this was not the case, instead i was told i need to take a picture of my bank statement for verification purposes. because i handle my affairs paperlessly i did not have a statement i could take a picture of and this company offered no other option for submitting the document. as a result i pulled up my virtual statement on one devise and took a picture with another and submitted. it then told me that it takes 5-7 days for the company to review my bank statement and approve my account. after 7 day i received an email notice that what i sent was insufficient and that i still needed to complete this step. 

i replied to the email explaining my problem and they replied for me to use a portal to upload my documents; however, i could not locate such portal. i then went to the bank to obtain a copy of my statement and took a picture the exact way they requested and waited another 7 days for them to reply to me. my result was the same as before (my document was insufficient. i replied to that email my frustration to which i received a reply that the issue is that the address on my statement was not a residential address i asked if it would be sufficient if i sent a copy of my state issued id with the matching address which they said would be suffice. i took a picture of my id in their system and sent a copy by email and waited another 7 days only to receive the same response.  i am now no longer interested in using this app as it should not be this difficult to enroll. i am going to continue my search for an investment app that is easy to use secure and will allow me to invest positively.

i had this set at 5 stars bc i thought it was but itÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs -1!  i purchased the $9 monthly subscription. incrementally across a month, i took about $5000 and invested. i used money from my 401k retirement and profits from employee stock purchase plan to do this. in just a few short months, my account was nearly $15,000. i was generally selling and reinvesting based on my own little strange path to determining which stock was on break out with percentage. i had reached a level that simply reinvesting was growing my account without adding additional funds. so in the last 30 days, i had stopped adding and started being able to both reinvest as well as use some of profits for other things in my life while still increasing. at the time this occurs (2 days ago) i not only get a message that thereÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs a reversal but that my account is locked. i knew i had not requested a deposit, nor was there any reason for stash not to receive funding as i had money in both the banking app and investment app. upon calling i hear that basically the clearing house apex demands my account closed and liquidated. why? because they can snd donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât have to tell me. 
they refuse to transfer my stocks to fidelity, e-trade, ameritrade - one of the reputable platforms, which means my tax bracket on capital gains will break me next year. they tell me that they will send email identifying the timeline. all the while they were already liquidating. they continually said we are doing this ok? i continually answered Ã£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âno it is not okÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Â in the moment i knew immediately it was because of my returns and positions with certain stock. upon downloading documents i began to notice certain receipts missing showing my positions - positions that brought returns at 60% in certain stocks, you see to send those to another firm was a very lucrative thing for quite some time. however, iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âm sure someone on the other side had plans for my positions but at this point i havenÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât connected the pieces. 

so i then begin to learn what form 13 is and how itÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs required. this still doesnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât necessarily mean anything until i figure out how the relationships work. you see apex is a clearing firm. number 1: they donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât generally hold stock except that in settlement. well selling mine aug 27 puts it in their firm Ã£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âso accidentallyÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Â on the 31st when i had two stock in full share amounts that are not only splitting but anticipated to increase by 33%. you say why not just purchase for themselves? because if you werenÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât in before a certain date, you donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât get the multiplication. they did this on thursday so that the exact settlement fell into their hands while they still hold all of my funds as well. again, because we can and we donÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât have to tell you - yet timing is uncanny and a little transparent when i take this further. based on this, what does it profit long term, apex has to relinquish it, or do they? 

turns out apex is owned by another company with a very special privaledge awarded from sec several years prior. this parent company is called peak6 investments. wow! there it is! an investment company hiding at the top with special privaledge for the clearing house (apex) to hold their investments. so apex can hold the stocks after all bc technically everything sold becomes potential derivative of peak6. now i do the math. letÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs suppose this occurs on all small accounts with this specific stock and they gain 20,000 shares. the 20,000 increases on monday to 100,000. the value of this 100,000 is somewhere near $50m. now add the potential boost up to 30% = another $15m. 
so $65m they leveraged (racketeered) from anyone who had this with right position that they felt didnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât make earn enough income to do anything about it. this includes all our minority and immigrant populations as well as those who work in positions that shouldnÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât be able to understand or discover the pattern. however, stash is greed for the beginners and population who have difficulty having the same advantage. yet you see, let us find the advantage, they will steel it Ã£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âbc they canÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Â they say. 

now letÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs add insult to injury. i not only had the one stock that will split monday, i had the two stock that will split monday. on top of that, my portfolio contained 3 more stocks that are set to split before years end. finally, my portfolio contained the stock known to be the ultimate 5g that will common knowledge soon. in fact it has been said in the first parts of september it should be announced by one of the first stock splitters on august 31. just that information is enough to tell you my $15k
was worth unlimited potential in the next 30 days. i had great positions and every single stock mentioned above was yielding 20%-60%. i think the 5g stock was actually at 66% last i checked at 4am on thursday just right before this occurred. 

looking thru records i found multiple accounts disclosed by peak 6 in july 2020 where this has been happening in mass. at the same time there are other subsidiaries with this parent company, so plenty of places to turn the funds into laundering capita and avoid true tax brackets that they pass on to those lower and middle income classes like me because they take upon themselves to liquidate without my request or approval - refusing to transfer not one account of 3. i had personal, ira, and custodial. well the ira and custodial come with extra special taxes. itÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs one thing if i do it. itÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs another like this. they can close an account bc they can but pretty sure there are laws especially dealing with retirement investments. i think enron ushered in quite a few. 

before i finish - one more note: my husband has stash, also, same stock but account is only worth a fraction of mine. not on 08/27 but 08/28 (my birthday at that) i receive an email to gift someone stash (wrong!) and his account gets locked / same process that happened to me. i told him to call the attorney, not stash, so itÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âs on record. iÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Âve made it personal to research documents. encourage others, do the same!

i was a huge fan of robinhood, both the app and the company.  finally there was a user friendly, helpful, encouraging platform to learn about, and use, the largest stock exchange in the world, for free!  i first learned about robinhood in my high school econ class and instantly fell in love.  they made it possible for everyone, not just the incredibly wealthy, trade stocks.  i opened my account on my 18th birthday, and got all my friends and family to join me soon after.  from then on i was on the app almost every day learning as much as i could about the market.  robinhood opened the doors and taught me to be a competent trader.  i felt like a big shot wall street stockbroker and it was awesome.  i was in charge of my money.  i was the one who decided what risks to take.  i had the opportunity to invest and grow the my money, to buy a car, a house, or maybe a wedding ring. but in the morning of january 28th of this year they went back on everything they stood for.  it broke my heart.  here i thought this awesome brokerage company was giving me all the same opportunities the big shots on wall street.  but i was wrong.  when those with all the money say jump, everyone say how high.

not secure, to the point of being dangerous. and caused by their attempts to implement security. the problem is, even if you turn on biometrics, they still require you to type your password into the app. that means every security camera is recording your login credentials. and it encourages users to use weak passwords. just let the users control the security, not everybody has the same needs and risk factors, and users need to manage that themselves. also it spams with silly notifications like "you've been logged out after 15 minutes of inactivity" and it spams me with notifications of all the activity i do using the website. the app shouldn't be notifying me about things i did on the website unless it is a security notification; i already know i just sold a security, i don't need my phone to beep 15 minutes later with redundant distractions.

i mostly use this app for its check-cashing feature, and it's recent redesign makes it more clunky and difficult to use. there are several unnecessary steps that for some reason the app pauses on. for example, when you enter in the amount of the check you can't just tap the screen to get out of the typing mode you have to tap "done"and there's like a five second pause where the app has to think. this sounds like a small problem, but it's really unnecessary and when you have to deposit multiple checks it actually adds a lot of time to the process. also when you photograph the check the app doesn't wait for the camera to autofocus. this means you have to watch the check and wait for the phone to focus before you take your picture as opposed to before where the phone would wait until the check was in focus for you. these may sound like small issues, but little design fixes would make this app a lot more usable for me.

this app has a software defect (bug) that causes it to crash when using the deposit check function with the 2013 version nexus 7 and certain other tablets and phones.  the crash occurs at the step where the user is about to photograph the check.  analysis of the java stack trace reveals that the app is not setting a parameter correctly when using one of the android "camera" java methods.  i've forwarded details to schwab about the cause of the problem along with a brief description of the software changes that need to be made to fix the problem.  when i called schwab about the problem, the rep claimed that they had no reports of this problem, but there are several reports of the problem right here on the reviews.    since a fundamental function of the app is broken, and since the problem manifests itself on a very commonly used android device, i am giving this app a "1 star" rating at this time.

as the title suggests, the longer i use stash, the less happy i am with it. 
i love that i have the ability to trade fractional shares without incurring additional trading costs, but this is far from the only app or website that offers that functionality.

all i want from an app like this is to have charts and graphs that display my portfolio performance, and the ability to bookmark and buy stocks, bonds, and etfs.
it feels like 70% of the interface is devoted to trying to get you to open a bank account and use their debit card, 20% is devoted to selling third party goods and services, and the remaining 10% is useful information and workable interfacing. 
undoubtedly these percentages reflect their respective revenues from each sector, as the annual $12 subscription fee canÃ£Â¢Ã¢ÂÃ¢Ât really support their business model. 

ps. in addition to charts and graphs measuring my portfolio performance, one feature that would be nice to have is also an area where you could track the performance of your bookmarked stocks, as a sort of paper trading, or to try and get a good deal on shares.

i really like the concept and the app, it's a great idea. it seems unfair that a lot of people are complaining about returns on their investment, that is really beyond acorns control, for the most part. this is definitely a long-term supplemental investment and savings tool, not a 401k. their customer support seems really willing to help, but is unable to solve what i would consider a basic problem. i use one credit card from a major international bank and i am unable to connect to my card. i was unable to connect when they launched the app and i am still unable to connect, after repeated exchanges with customer support. i verified all the parameters to link the accounts and triple checked them, but there seems to be a glitch that doesn't allow the account to link through acorns. they even verified it wasn't an issue on my side, but never fixed it. it is a little concerning when you can't just log on and simply link the most common type of credit card from one of the most prevalent card issuers.

i really like this app and the whole concept of personal capital, but...

both personal capitol & this app lack a budgeting feature! 

what i like about the personal capitol is that it's focused on your net worth. right on the top of the app and their page is a constant reminder of your balance between debts and assets. i'm young and want to focus on my future and don't have (or want to spend) the time using multiple services to plan my financial future. a budget is a big part of planning for a financial future. the fact that i can not do that with personal capitol is their weakest link. planning and controlling my spending allows me to plan more easily divert funds to investments. 

update: "categories"
i have a few issues with the categories as well. all related to "other" subcategories. first, the other categories do not graph (like income & spending). secondly, and more importantly, credit card payments are categorized under "other" and thus do not show when you analyze your spending. of credit card payments are not spending, then you mortgage may as well be income.

bottom line: 
this app/service without a budgeting feature = 1 out 5 stars 
this app/service with a budgeting feature = 5 out of 5 stars

i started with acorn almost right after it launched. i did it to see how it stacked up on a earnings performance. i have invested thousands in incremental round-up.

they've made it virtually impossible to cancel from the android or desktop 
app. so please consider the below as a caution against ever joining acorns 
to begin with. the value of them charging $1 a month to invest your pennies 
is questionable. they invest in six specific etfs. you can use robinhood to 
buy them directly without fees. there's very little mystery here. acorns 
isn't doing anything complicated. "but i can only invest a little every 
month." then you're probably better off holding on to cash than using 
acorns. assuming you invest $100 in acorns in a year, you will have paid 
out 12% ($12) in fees. you're unlikely to break even at that rate. "but i 
like their auto deposit feature." do the same with robinhood and buy the 
etfs directly. or just buy them on demand (without auto deposit). "but i 
like investing whole or partial dollars and not having to think about where 
the investments go." then acorns might be good for you, assuming you have 
exhausted better investment vehicles that might be available to you like 
401k or hsa. "but i like the found money feature." well, if you game it 
right i'm sure you can get a few good deals. hats off to you. but it's the 
same sort of endeavor as playing the points games on credit cards. it will 
get tedious; the house always wins in the long run. look, i wouldn't be 
writing this if they made it easier to cancel. good luck trying. it's 
inordinantly difficult. avoid. edit: acorns has reached out and offered 
"assistance with closing my account." i have already closed my account, 
which was a reprehensible challenge. can't do it from the android app, 
can't do it from the web app. it took a separate google search for how to 
close my account. it should not require an intervention. acorns, make it 
easier to cancel! ask yourself if your customers are clients or victims.

i've used robinhood as my primary broker for the last year now. i've experienced several technical issues but nothing too big to make me switch platforms. the app fit my needs as it was super user friendly and great for a novice trader like myself. however, i wouldn't recommend this app to traders with a lot of capital -- robinhood only offers $1,000 of instant buying power and bank transfers take extremely long to be approved. i invested in both gme and amc and woke up the next morning to see that i was unable to buy any new shares. i was only given the option to sell my shares, which is clearly market manipulation. robinhood sells personal information and trading information to companies such as citadel and actively chose to tank their company in order to protect hedge funds. quite ironic that an app named robinhood would steal from the poor and give to the rich.

heres a deconstruction of what's wrong with this app. first, its cluttered with features that nobody asked for. clearly user research was never really done, and all the features in this app were agreed on by executives either lacking or disregarding design. the whole app experience is disjointed, and it makes it hard to do simple things like calculate how much interest your portfolio has gained over a year. it clearly looks like development was rushed because that's not calculated correctly either, only bases your earning % on what you're currently holding. lastly it's 2016 and this app doesn't use touchid and requires constant reauthentication which is an f on security design. they haven't done this most likely because executives have prioritized stupid features over getting the basic user experience right. when an app managing my ira uses primitive authentication methods, i feel less safe, not more.

this app used to be rock solid, but lately, since about version 3.55 or 3.55.1, it's been a little concerning security-wise. it no longer displays my name when i log in (even though the switch is on), tells me it can't connect to the glance network when i start it up (why would i ever need to give someone remote access?), and sometimes even shows i have no accounts, or accounts with no balances/positions when i refresh a page (closing the app and signing in again fixes it, but why would my session time out if im actively using the app?). the latest version's icons are spaced poorly on my device, and fonts such as those used for 'accounts' have changed to match the apple system as opposed to the fidelity fonts i'm used to. call me paranoid, but what's stopping an attacker on my home network (via a compromised device/router) from putting my device in a domain and distributing a fake app as part of a group policy? i might i think i'm trading and making gains, but in reality my accounts have been cleaned out. when significant sums of money are involved, little bugs and changes like those above cause big concerns. furthermore, the app allows you to transfer via paypal, and now allows transferring retirement accounts to other users.  instead of features, you're adding new vectors for clients to get their clocks cleaned by potential attackers. don't make it easier to withdraw/transfer funds when institutional/device security lags the advancements made by cyber criminals, make it almost impossible to withdraw funds! how about issuing a hardware key fob with nfc, similar to what the real estate database company costar uses to protect its data and accounts, to clients with over $250k? moral of the story, the app feels more vulnerable to malicious activity than in the past.

after these two weeks, i had successfully input all my information three times and the warning box for needed info went away.

after, a week passed before i even got an automated email recognizing the forwarding of my information to the "compliance department".  after that, yet another week passed without any further communication and a lack of account verification.
